name: Git
title: This cheat sheet summarizes commonly used Git command line instructions for quick reference.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: This cheat sheet summarizes commonly used Git command line instructions for quick reference.

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body:
Create a new local repository

```shell script
$ git init [project name]
```

Clone a repository

```shell script
$ git clone git_url
```

Clone a repository into a specified directory

```shell script
$ git clone git_url my_directory
```

cards.title: Make%20a%20change
cards.body: Show%20modified%20files%20in%20working%20directory%2C%20staged%20for%20your%20next%20commit%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20status%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AStages%20the%20file%2C%20ready%20for%20commit%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20add%20%5Bfile%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AStage%20all%20changed%20files%2C%20ready%20for%20commit%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20add%20.%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACommit%20all%20staged%20files%20to%20version%20history%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20commit%20-m%20%22commit%20message%22%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACommit%20all%20your%20tracked%20files%20to%20version%20history%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20commit%20-am%20%22commit%20message%22%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ADiscard%20changes%20in%20working%20directory%20which%20is%20not%20staged%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20restore%20%5Bfile%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AUnstage%20a%20staged%20file%20or%20file%20which%20is%20staged%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20restore%20--staged%20%5Bfile%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AUnstage%20a%20file%2C%20keeping%20the%20file%20changes%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20reset%20%5Bfile%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ARevert%20everything%20to%20the%20last%20commit%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20reset%20--hard%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ADiff%20of%20what%20is%20changed%20but%20not%20staged%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20diff%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ADiff%20of%20what%20is%20staged%20but%20not%20yet%20committed%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20diff%20--staged%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AApply%20any%20commits%20of%20current%20branch%20ahead%20of%20specified%20one%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20rebase%20%5Bbranch%5D%0A%60%60%60

cards.title: Configuration
cards.body: Set%20the%20name%20that%20will%20be%20attached%20to%20your%20commits%20and%20tags%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20config%20--global%20user.name%20%22name%22%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ASet%20an%20email%20address%20that%20will%20be%20attached%20to%20your%20commits%20and%20tags%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20config%20--global%20user.email%20%22email%22%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AEnable%20some%20colorization%20of%20Git%20output%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20config%20--global%20color.ui%20auto%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AEdit%20the%20global%20configuration%20file%20in%20a%20text%20editor%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20config%20--global%20--edit%0A%60%60%60

cards.title: Working with Branches
cards.body:
List all local branches

```shell script
$ git branch
```

List all branches, local and remote

```shell script
$ git branch -av
```

Switch to my_branch, and update working directory

```shell script
$ git checkout my_branch
```

Create a new branch called new_branch

```shell script
$ git checkout -b new_branch
```

Delete the branch called my_branch

```shell script
$ git branch -d my_branch
```

Merge branchA into branchB

```shell script
$ git checkout branchB
$ git merge branchA
```

Tag the current commit

```shell script
$ git tag my_tag
```

cards.title: Observe your Repository
cards.body:
Show the commit history for the currently active branch

```shell script
$ git log
```

Show the commits on branchA that are not on branchB

```shell script
$ git log branchB..branchA
```

Show the commits that changed file, even across renames

```shell script
$ git log --follow [file]
```

Show the diff of what is in branchA that is not in branchB

```shell script
$ git diff branchB...branchA
```

Show any object in Git in human-readable format

```shell script
$ git show [SHA]
```

cards.title: Synchronize
cards.body:
Fetch down all the branches from that Git remote

```shell script
$ git fetch [alias]
```

Merge a remote branch into your current branch to bring it up to date

```shell script
$ git merge [alias]/[branch]
# No fast-forward
$ git merge --no-ff [alias]/[branch]
# Only fast-forward
$ git merge --ff-only [alias]/[branch]
```

Transmit local branch commits to the remote repository branch

```shell script
$ git push [alias] [branch]
```

Fetch and merge any commits from the tracking remote branch

```shell script
$ git pull
```

Merge just one specific commit from another branch to your current branch

```shell script
$ git cherry-pick [commit_id]
```

cards.title: Remote
cards.body: Add%20a%20git%20URL%20as%20an%20alias%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20remote%20add%20%5Balias%5D%20%5Burl%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AShow%20the%20names%20of%20the%20remote%20repositories%20you've%20set%20up%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20remote%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AShow%20the%20names%20and%20URLs%20of%20the%20remote%20repositories%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20remote%20-v%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ARemove%20a%20remote%20repository%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20remote%20rm%20%5Bremote%20repo%20name%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AChange%20the%20URL%20of%20the%20git%20repo%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20remote%20set-url%20origin%20%5Bgit_url%5D%0A%60%60%60

cards.title: Temporary Commits
cards.body:
Save modified and staged changes

```shell script
$ git stash
```

List stack-order of stashed file changes

```shell script
$ git stash list
```

Write working from top of stash stack

```shell script
$ git stash pop
```

Discard the changes from top of stash stack

```shell script
$ git stash drop
```

cards.title: Tracking path Changes
cards.body:
Delete the file from project and stage the removal for commit

```shell script
$ git rm [file]
```

Change an existing file path and stage the move

```shell script
$ git mv [existing-path] [new-path]
```

Show all commit logs with indication of any paths that moved

```shell script
$ git log --stat -M
```

cards.title: Ignoring%20Files
cards.body: %60%60%60%0A%2Flogs%2F*%0A%0A%23%20%22!%22%20means%20don't%20ignore%0A!logs%2F.gitkeep%0A%0A%2F%23%20Ignore%20Mac%20system%20files%0A.DS_store%0A%0A%23%20Ignore%20node_modules%20folder%0Anode_modules%0A%0A%23%20Ignore%20SASS%20config%20files%0A.sass-cache%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AA%20%60.gitignore%60%20file%20specifies%20intentionally%20untracked%20files%20that%20Git%20should%20ignore

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.body:
• #### **Renamed** to `new_name`

  ```shell script
  $ git branch -m <new_name>
  ```

• #### **Push** and reset

  ```shell script
  $ git push origin -u <new_name>
  ```

• #### **Delete** remote branch

  ```shell script
  $ git push origin --delete <old>
  ```

cards.title: Log
cards.body: Search%20change%20by%20content%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20-S'%3Ca%20term%20in%20the%20source%3E'%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AShow%20changes%20over%20time%20for%20specific%20file%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20-p%20%3Cfile_name%3E%0A%60%60%60%0A%0APrint%20out%20a%20cool%20visualization%20of%20your%20log%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%20%7B.wrap%7D%0A%24%20git%20log%20--pretty%3Doneline%20--graph%20--decorate%20--all%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20files%20changed%20in%20a%20commit%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20--name-only%20%3Ccommit-id%3E%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20files%20changed%20in%20commits%20excluding%20merges%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20--no-merges%20--name-only%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ALimit%20commits%20to%20the%20last%20N%20entries%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20-%3Cnumber%3E%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ALimit%20commits%20to%20the%20last%20N%20entries%20(alternate%20syntax)%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20-n%20%3Cnumber%3E%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ALimit%20commits%20to%20a%20maximum%20of%20N%20entries%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20--max-count%3D%3Cnumber%3E%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AShow%20commits%20more%20recent%20than%20a%20specific%20date%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20--after%3D%22YYYY-MM-DD%20HH%3AMM%3ASS%20%C2%B1HHMM%22%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AShow%20commits%20older%20than%20a%20specific%20date%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20--before%3D%22YYYY-MM-DD%20HH%3AMM%3ASS%20%C2%B1HHMM%22%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AFilter%20commits%20by%20author%20matching%20a%20pattern%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20--author%3D%3Cpattern%3E%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AFilter%20commits%20by%20commit%20message%20matching%20a%20pattern%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20--grep%3D%3Cpattern%3E%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AShow%20commit%20graph%20of%20the%20current%20branch%20with%20reference%20decorations%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20--graph%20--decorate%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AShow%20commit%20graph%20of%20a%20specific%20branch%20without%20switching%20to%20it%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20--graph%20--decorate%20%3Cbranch%3E%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AShow%20commit%20graph%20for%20commits%20in%20one%20branch%20not%20in%20another%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20--graph%20--decorate%20%3CbranchB%3E..%3CbranchA%3E%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AShow%20commit%20graph%20of%20all%20branches%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20log%20--graph%20--decorate%20--all%0A%60%60%60

cards.title: Branch
cards.body:
List all branches and their upstreams

```shell script
$ git branch -vv
```

Quickly switch to the previous branch

```shell script
$ git checkout -
```

Get only remote branches

```shell script
$ git branch -r
```

Checkout a single file from another branch

```shell script
$ git checkout <branch> -- <file>
```

cards.title: Rewriting%20history
cards.body: Rewrite%20last%20commit%20message%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20commit%20--amend%20-m%20%22new%20message%22%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AAmend%20the%20latest%20commit%20without%20changing%20the%20commit%20message.%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20commit%20--amend%20--no-edit%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ASee%20also%3A%20%5BRewriting%20history%5D(https%3A%2F%2Fwww.atlassian.com%2Fgit%2Ftutorials%2Frewriting-history)

cards.title: Git Aliases
cards.body:
```cmd
git config --global alias.co checkout
git config --global alias.br branch
git config --global alias.ci commit
git config --global alias.st status
```

See also: [More Aliases](https://gist.github.com/johnpolacek/69604a1f6861129ef088)

cards.title: Worktrees
cards.body:
Create a new working tree at the specified path. If a branch is specified, it checks out that branch. If no branch is given, a new one is created based on HEAD and named after the new directory.

```shell script
$ git worktree add <path> [<branch>]
```

List all of the active working trees associated with the repository.

```shell script
$ git worktree list
```

Remove the specified working tree.

```shell script
$ git worktree remove <path>
```

Clean up stale or manually deleted working trees.

```shell script
$ git worktree prune
```

Relocate the working tree to a new path.

```shell script
$  git worktree move <old_path> <new_path>
```

cards.title: Submodules
cards.body: Create%20a%20new%20submodule%20within%20your%20repository%3A%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20submodule%20add%20%3Crepository_url%3E%20%3Cpath%3E%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AClone%20a%20repository%20and%20initialize%20its%20submodules%3A%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20clone%20--recursive%20%3Crepository_url%3E%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AUpdate%20all%20the%20submodules%20in%20your%20repository%20to%20the%20latest%20commit%20of%20their%20respective%20branches%3A%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20submodule%20update%0A%60%60%60%0A%0APull%20the%20latest%20changes%20from%20the%20remote%20repositories%20of%20the%20submodules%20and%20update%20them%20in%20your%20main%20repository%3A%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20submodule%20update%20--remote%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ARemove%20a%20submodule%20from%20your%20repository%3A%0A%0A%60%60%60shell%20script%0A%24%20git%20submodule%20deinit%20%3Cpath%3E%0A%24%20git%20rm%20%3Cpath%3E%0A%24%20git%20commit%20-m%20%22Removed%20submodule%22%0A%60%60%60

cards.title: Cherry-picking
cards.body:
Cherry-picking allows you to apply a specific commit from one branch to another branch.

```shell script
$ git cherry-pick <commit_hash>
```

cards.title: Reflog
cards.body:
Display the reflog, showing the history of HEAD and branch movements:

```shell script
$ git reflog
```

Find the hash of the lost commit or branch using the reflog and then checkout to that hash to restore it:

```shell script
$ git checkout <commit_or_branch_hash>
```
